thread.title: L’argenteria 2.0 di Christopher Jenner
thread.title_full: L’argenteria 2.0 di Christopher Jenner

posts.author: Luca Trombetta
posts.title: L’argenteria 2.0 di Christopher Jenner
posts.text:
Arredamento / Cucina L’argenteria 2.0 di Christopher Jenner Il designer rilancia lo storico marchio Elkington & Co con una collezione attuale in argento Sheffield stampata in 3D e tagliata al laser Testo Massimo De Conti – Foto © Michael Franke Sfoglia la gallery 
«Sono io il piatto forte della settimana!», scherza Christopher Jenner . Il designer di origine sudafricana esordisce con una battuta alla presentazione di Epicurean , 12 pezzi per la tavola che ha disegnato per E&Co. , la storica manifattura Elkington che nel primo Novecento produsse gli argenti per il Titanic e i trofei del torneo di Wimbledon. La nuova collezione copre tutte le portate e tutte le occasioni: un secchiello per il ghiaccio, un porta snack, delle bacchette per sushi, un set sale e pepe, un piatto per il burro, una saliera da cucina, un cucchiaio da portata, un coltello da formaggio e un contenitore per il miele. Come abbiamo visto durante l’ultima design week milanese ( la sua sala da tè in Brera è stata una celebrazione della ceramica ), Jenner ama approfondire il rapporto coi materiali. 
In questa occasione indaga la lavorazione dell’ argento Sheffield , nella sontuosa cornice di una sala da pranzo allestita nel negozio di oggetti di lusso Thomas Goode & Co a Mayfair. Il proposito è quello di unire la tradizione dell’argenteria da tavola inglese con i metodi di produzione più attuali, come la stampa 3D e il taglio al laser : «Utilizzando le nuove tecnologie – spiega – non si toglie nulla all’essenza artigianale degli oggetti». Il design è quasi minimale, «con prezzi accessibili al consumatore moderno, anche giovane, che deve ritrovare una certa qualità della vita».

thread.title: Candidati per Rock & Roll Hall of Fame
thread.title_full: Candidati per Rock & Roll Hall of Fame

posts.title: Candidati per Rock & Roll Hall of Fame
posts.text: CULTURA E SPETTACOLO Candidati per Rock & Roll Hall of Fame 19:34 (ANSA) - NEW YORK - Arrivano le nomination per entrare nel tempio del rock. Per la prima volta i Radiohead e i Rage Against the Machine sono stati candidati per entrare nella Rock & Roll Hall of Fame nel 2018 (prima non avevano i requisiti poiche' devono essere trascorsi almeno 25 anni dal singolo o album di esordio). Tra i nominati - in totale 19, di tutti i generi musicali - ci sono anche Bon Jovi, Kate Bush, The Cars, Depeche Mode, Dire Straits, Eurythmics, J. Geils Band, Judas Priest, LL Cool J, MC5, The Meters, Moody Blues, Rufus featuring Chaka Khan, Nina Simone, Sister Rosetta Tharpe, Link Wray, The Zombies. A partire da oggi fino al 5 dicembre si può votare sul sito ufficiale, e i cinque artisti che riceveranno il maggior numero di voti accederanno ad un'estrazione da cui si sapranno i vincitori. La premiazione e' in programma il prossimo 14 aprile a Cleveland.

thread.title_full: Vino e Moda

posts.author: Marco Lottaroli
posts.title: Vino e Moda
posts.text: Guarda date e orari Vino & Moda, ovvero bottiglie pregiate e griffe, un connubio vincente e di grande richiamo, ancora una volta il leitmotiv della nuova edizione de "La Vendemmia" The World's Finest Wine and Lifestyle Experience: evento che unisce eleganza, stile e "savoir vivre". Si apre lunedì 9 ottobre e prosegue fino a domenica 15 ottobre la settimana di appuntamenti (anche benefici) che coinvolge le boutique (shopping experience il 13-14 ottobre) del quadrilatero dove il fashion e il lusso sono di casa, via MonteNapoleone, via Sant'Andrea, via Verri, via Bagutta, via Borgospesso, via Santo Spirito, e alcuni importanti ristoranti (degustazioni e menu a prezzi speciali) milanesi. Inoltre il 12 ottobre la Sala delle Colonne di Palazzo Bovara (corso Venezia 51) ospiterà l'Asta Christie's di vini esclusivi - Italian Masters (a favore Dynamo Camp), e il 13 ottobre a Palazzo Serbelloni (corso Venezia 16) è in programma l'evento "Tasting Grandi Cru" (prenotazione obbligatoria). In gemellaggio con la Fiera Internazionale del Tartufo Bianco di Alba. A cura MonteNapoleone District in collaborazione con il Comitato Grandi Cru d’Italia. Sito: https://www.montenapoleone.luxury/it.html Tag

thread.title_full: Sul "genio" di Madonna "fra i 100 artisti e cantautori di se

posts.author: Ri-dave
posts.title: Sul "genio" di Madonna "fra i 100 artisti e cantautori di se
posts.text:
Sul "genio" di Madonna "fra i 100 artisti e cantautori di sempre", che "batte" i Beatles Ai soloni problematici che citano sempre i siti musicali di riferimento internazionali, come auctoritas a cui inchinarsi, farei presente un minimo di coerenza affinché possano, se non risultare coerenti, perlomeno non fare la figura dei peracottari...
1) SEI ASPETTI CHE SPIEGANO IL GENIO DI MADONNA
https://pitchfork.com/thepitch/6-sides-of-madonna-that-explain-her-genius-listening-guide/
2) MADONNA DAVANTI AI BEATLES http://www.billboard.com/articles/events/greatest-of-all-time/6760664/madonna-most-billboard-hot-100-top-10-hits
3) MADONNA 36° FRA I 100 ARTISTI DI SEMPRE
Rolling Stone's 100 Greatest Artists of All Time
4) MADONNA 56° FRA I CANTAUTORI DI SEMPRE http://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/100-greatest-songwriters
5) E, infine, giusto per celebrare il XXV di EROTICA
https://www.slantmagazine.com/music/review/madonna-erotica e http://www.nme.com/photos/50-mind-blowing-albums-that-changed-nme-readers-lives-1417714
...immagino la bile e l'imbarazzo nel vedersi sconfessare così clamorosamente dagli stessi punti di riferimento di chi, evidentemente smarrito nel mondo, non manca occasione di farsi etero orientare nei propri gusti musicali: che dire, per restare al livello prosaico, "sócc'mel"!

posts.author: redazione
posts.title: Nuovo smalto per Sèvres
posts.text: Tendenze / Design Nuovo smalto per Sèvres La celebre manifattura francese di porcellana ha reclutato i guru del colore Scholten&Baijings per rispolverare l'archivio storico e firmare due nuove collezioni di piatti e vasi Redazione Living Sfoglia la gallery Il duo olandese Scholten & Baijings con il colore ci sa fare . Non a caso la Manufacture de Sèvres li ha reclutati per rispolverare l’archivio storico ed elaborare nuove ceramiche insieme ai maestri smaltatori. Sono nate così due collezioni di piatti e vasi decorati con griglie geometriche e sovrapposizioni cromatiche che indugiano su tonalità pastello e sfumature sempre più brillanti. A tiratura limitata, si possono acquistare alla Galerie de Sèvres di Parigi e presso lo showroom della manifattura alle porte della capitale. L’univers coloré de Scholten & Baijings dove: Galerie de Sèvres, 4 place André Malraux, Parigi, tel. +33/147034020 Living Per

thread.title: Andrea Franzoso: from heroic whistleblower to outcast
thread.title_full: Andrea Franzoso: from heroic whistleblower to outcast

posts.author: Gian Antonio Stella
posts.title: Andrea Franzoso: from heroic whistleblower to outcast
posts.text:
“I came, I saw, I kept my mouth shut”. When American columnist Donald Herron tweaked the famous phrase uttered by Julius Caesar in the wake of his victory over Pharnaces II of Pontus, he perfectly summed up a certain attitude to life. And when Andrea Franzoso, the official at Ferrovie Nord Milano, who with the help of his colleague Luigi Nocerino, reported the then President Norberto Achille for his astronomic expenses, many of his colleagues also came, saw, and kept their mouths shut.
Personal use
They acted astounded when Luigi Ferrarella wrote in the Corriere that Achilles was accused of “having earmarked two mobile phones for the almost exclusive use of his wife and one of his sons, while his other son was authorised to charge his calls to his father’s work number, resulting in a cost to the company of around €124,000”. Then there was the “significant use of corporate credit cards by family members,” according to the investigating magistrate, “to pay for personal expenses of various kinds: €14,000 in clothing, 30,000 in furnishings and electronics, [...] €3,700 in bets on sporting events and €17,000 in hotels and restaurants”. Nor should we forget “dog grooming costs” and over €180,000 in traffic fines. The list goes on, for a total of at least half a million euros.
Relieved of duties
Many may claim that they were unable to act, or did not have access to certain files, so had no way of knowing if someone was fiddling expenses. Nevertheless, everyone, or almost everyone, knew about the investigation, and were content to sit back and gloat over the fall of the company’s high and mighty. Everyone, or almost everyone, avidly read the newspaper reports, such as the one that mentioned the €7,634 spent “on pay-TV subscriptions, including charges for a series of pornographic films”. Everyone, or almost everyone, knew of the company’s reaction, which was to gradually isolate the whistleblower, who in a serious country should have been rewarded for bringing down the career of someone who had fiddled expenses on taxpayers’ money. Instead, he was removed from financial auditing and moved to an office without specific duties, to encourage him, with polite cynicism, to leave. This is a disgrace.
“Where had she been all this time?”
Yet, with few exceptions, everyone saw, and everyone kept their mouths shut. Andrea Franzoso writes in his book “Il disobbediente” (publised by PaperFirst) that on the day when it emerged that he was behind the exposé, he was inundated with colleagues eager to congratulate him, including one of Achille’s former secretaries, “She is a very attractive woman of about forty. Tall, blonde, always in great form and dressed in designer clothes. Shaking her fists, she shouted out: “Way to go!”. She then smiled shyly and asked me: “Can I give you a hug?”. I stepped forward and she came towards me with open arms. She held me close and gave me two big kisses on my cheeks, saying ‘Thank you, Andrea’. [...] I looked at her with a pang of bitterness. Where had she been all this time?”
Marginalised
He would later recall, after his gradual marginalisation, that “the bravest, those who were the first to openly express their support for me and Luigi Nocerino, were also the first to turn their backs on us and ingratiate themselves with the new management.” The company was entrusted by the Northern League governor of Lombardy, Roberto Maroni, to the new chairman of Ferrovie Nord Milano and fellow party member Andrea Gibelli. His appointment was made “to ensure greater simplification and transparency”. The management’s first move was to remove not the many who “had seen nothing”, but those who had reported episodes of misconduct, in what was an explicit taking of sides.
Comparison with Auschwitz
Even more explicit is the conversation between Andrea Franzoso and the former chairman of the board of auditors, Carlo Alberto Belloni. The conversation was recorded, transcribed and enclosed with the claim submitted to the employment tribunal, as well as being subsequently published by Marco Lillo in Italian newspaper Il Fatto. Belloni, unable to understand why Franzoso had homed in on these cases of misconduct, said: “I told you and Nocerino not to insist going down the path you had taken”. He then came out with a somewhat bizarre statement: “The commander of Auschwitz, who was certainly no saint [...], the only thing he never did was investigate the auditors sent from Berlin. Never. He never did that. He had a committee of auditors, he had the camp’s internal supervisory body, made up of members of the SS”. He then applied this anecdote to the Northern League’s Laura Quaini, chair of the Control and Risks Committee, who played a “decisive” role, according to Lillo, “in helping honest auditors like Franzoso”, and was (of course) not confirmed as a board member. The former chairman of the board of auditors in fact went on to say that: “When an SS officer woke up, in this case Quaini, woke up and said, ‘We need to investigate the commander, ... the head auditor from Berlin’, he was basically saying: ‘Look, you’re not a perfect Arian; prepare yourself for the gas chamber’”. Yes, he actually said that.
Honesty
Of course, Andrea Franzoso is not the first person in Italian history to have paid dearly for being honest and taking on the “gods almighty”, as Luigi Einaudi called them. We need merely remember the patriot and follower of Garibaldi, Cristiano Lobbia, who on 5 June 1869 reported to parliament in Florence that Regia Tabacchi (the state-owned tobacco monopoly) had been handed over for 15 years to anonymous wheeler-dealers linked to the Credito Mobiliare bank for an advance payment of 180 million lire. This had happened despite the fact that it was, according to the banker Rothschild, “the state’s only secure income”, and that the amount was less than half that offered at better conditions by financiers in Paris and London. The parliamentarian from Garibaldi’s ranks was initially hailed as a hero, only to be destroyed by a smear campaign of unprecedented fury.
Examples
A similar fate of marginalisation and isolation awaited many others, such as Like Luca Magni, the businessman with a cleaning company who decided to rebel against the continuous demands made by the chairman of Pio Albergo Trivulzio, Mario Chiesa. He ended up on the front pages as a hero, but 20 years later would admit: “I would do it all again, but this time I would try to protect myself better. I blew the whistle on the system of backhanders that was choking my company, but I didn’t imagine that in a short time I would lose all my contracts.”
Is it worth it?
We could go on for days, listing name after name and scandal upon scandal. So one wonders, is it worth speaking out? This is a question asked by all those in Italy who have been waiting for years for a law to protect whistle-blowers. “Yes, it was worth it” is the answer Andrea Franzoso gives in his book. Despite everything. Because, as Martin Luther King said, one day we will be called to account, and “will have to repent not merely for the hateful words and actions of the bad people but for the appalling silence of the good people.”
English translation by Simon Tanner www.simontanner.com
Article in Italian

thread.title: Dakota Johnson & Irina Sheyk, a New York per Intimissimi - Corriere.it
thread.title_full: Dakota Johnson & Irina Sheyk, a New York per Intimissimi - Corriere.it

posts.author: corriere.it
posts.title: Dakota Johnson & Irina Sheyk, a New York per Intimissimi - Corriere.it
posts.text: Dakota Johnson & Irina Shayk, a New York per Intimissimi Non ha deluso le aspettative l’inaugurazione della boutique di Intimissimi, il brand del Gruppo Calzedonia sbarcato a New York, sulla Quinta Strada, pronto a sfidare il brand di lingerie globale Victoria’s Secret. Attrici, blogger giornaliste/i hanno affollato la boutique su due piani con i completi di lingerie decisamente raffinata. Nell’elenco degli ospiti c’era anche Suki Waterhouse, l’ex di Bradley Cooper, oggi fidanzato con Irina Shayk (nella foto insieme a Dakota Johnson), ma non si è presentata e qualcuno tira un sospiro di sollievo. Irina ovviamente c’era ed è stata molto ammirata (anche dal calciatore Andrea Pirlo) come le altre tre testimonial del brand italiano: Dakota Johnson che a febbraio tornerà per la terza volta al cinema con Cinquanta sfumature di rosso, l’ex tennista serba Ana Ivanovic e l’inglese imprenditrice e autrice di libri di cucina Ella Mills. Ma il premio simpatia va a Sarah Jessica Parker, 52 anni, che prende le distanze da Carrie di Sex and the City ma non perde la passione per la moda: è arrivata vestita come una debuttante: gonna in tulle nero e top in pizzo bianco con balconcino nero in trasparenza testo di Maria Teresa Veneziani

thread.title: Talco J&J e cancro alle ovaie: giudice Usa rigetta risarcimento di 417 milioni di dollari
thread.title_full: Talco J&J e cancro alle ovaie: giudice Usa rigetta risarcimento di 417 milioni di dollari

posts.author: Cristina Marrone
posts.title: Talco J&J e cancro alle ovaie: giudice Usa rigetta risarcimento di 417 milioni di dollari
posts.text: & Johnson avesse agito con dolo e il risarcimento richiesto è stato giudicato eccessivo. La decisione sarà nuovamente appellata - ha già annunciato l’avvocato Mark Robinson Jr. - anche se la querelante Eva Echeverria è nel frattempo deceduta. «Continueremo a batterci in nome di tutte le donne che hanno subito danni da questo pericoloso prodotto», ha detto in un comunicato. & Johnson di non aver sufficientemente messo in guardia i consumatori del fatto che il talco potesse favorire il cancro. La donna lo aveva utilizzato ogni giorno dall’inizio degli anni ‘50 fino al 2016. Nel 2007 le era stato diagnosticato il cancro al tumore. Nella tesi dell’accusa, Echeverria aveva sviluppato il cancro alle ovaie come un «probabile risultato della natura difettosa e irragionevolmente pericolosa della polvere di talco». E il suo avvocato ha sostenuto che la società era al corrente da 30 anni dei rischi del prodotto. & Johnson ha espresso soddisfazione per la nuova sentenza: «Il cancro alle ovaie è una patologia devastante - afferma in una nota - ma non è causata dal talco cosmetico usato per decenni quale componente del Johnson’s baby powder. La scienza è stata chiara su questo e continueremo a difendere la sicurezza del prodotto preparandoci a nuovi test negli Stati Uniti». ” da tempo e l’Agenzia internazionale per la ricerca sul cancro (lo Iarc di Lione) ha classificato le polveri per il corpo a base di talco come possibili cancerogeni per l’uomo nel 2006. Possibili (insieme a centinaia di altre sostanze), non probabili e neppure certe. L’ipotesi avanzata dai ricercatori è che la polvere di talco, contenente agenti infiammatori, si diffonda dagli organi genitali esterni a quelli interni femminili causando infiammazioni di lunga durata che, a loro volta, stimolano la formazione di un tumore. «Ad oggi, però, nonostante i numerosi studi condotti negli anni, non ci sono prove a sufficienza per stabilire un legame tra talco e cancro», dice Paolo Scollo, presidente della Società italiana di Ginecologia e Ostetricia. La conclusione a cui giungono gli esperti quindi è che non ci sono sufficienti elementi per dimostrare un rapporto tra l’utilizzo del talco sui genitali e l’insorgere di una qualche forma di cancro. ’Alabama deceduta, sostenendo che lo Stato non aveva giurisdizione sul caso (in primo grado invece la J&J era stata condannata al risarcimento) . Nel maggio 2016 la multinazionale americana era stata condannata a risarcire 55 milioni di dollari a Gloria Ristesund , 62enne del South Dakota, malata di tumore alle ovaie, che per 35 anni aveva utilizzato il talco «Baby Powder» per l’igiene intima. thread.title: LETTERA Integrazione? Il “caso Versilia”
thread.title_full: LETTERA Integrazione? Il “caso Versilia”

thread.title_full: Giorgio Armani: we’ll grow togheter Let’s talk about the future - Corriere.it

posts.author: Maria Silvia Sacchi
posts.title: Giorgio Armani: we’ll grow togheter Let’s talk about the future - Corriere.it
posts.text: Ascolta Email It’s no secret that Giorgio Armani has always shied away from broaching the subject of his succession, as he himself will readily admit. And yet, it is precisely this topic that has kept him busy for the past few years and still engages him today on a mental, emotional and practical level. The reason behind this is his desire to ensure continuity and prosperity to his company. He’s doing it for himself, his employees, his suppliers, his production areas – in one word, for all the so-called stakeholders – and it’s a willingness he shares with the best entrepreneurs who devote themselves to a similar lifelong commitment. It has taken Armani the best part of five years to work out the most suitable framework, and after a thorough consideration he has opted for a foundation, a legally established institution in line with the lean and straightforward organization, steeped in Italian values, which has been the distinguishing feature of his enterprise since its beginnings. To announce what the market had been waiting to hear for a long time, our fashion designer/entrepreneur has kept well away from the limelight, choosing instead to issue a brief press release of just a couple of lines in the middle of last Summer. After that, total silence. Now the time has come, at last, to offer some explanations and to reassess the strategies that will shape the future of the Giorgio Armani brand in the years to come. There has been a flurry of meetings, investments and adjustments to help the group adapt to the new Zeitgeist, but without ever losing sight of that vision which has enabled the company to rake in 2,5 bn euro profits in recent years. And on this Giorgio Armani has been adamant, to the point of leaving precise written instructions for future generations, with the aim of ensuring continuous growth and development for his group. «But I won’t be here to see it» he says ruefully «and I find it very hard to take. It’s one thing being an old man, and quite another being in charge of the employment and well-being of 8 thousand people, 8 thousand families. Time… I’m simply amazed at the speed with which I’ve made it to where I am today. I have given my all to my business and my creations. I’ve locked myself up at numbers 21, 18 and 11 (the street numbers of Via Borgonuovo in Milan where his main offices are located, and the new headquarters in via Bergognone, Editor’s note) or in the big international capitals where shows were scheduled, but without ever getting a chance to explore all those places. My entire world is right here. Sometimes I wonder if it was the right choice, but one has to take into account one’s own temperament, what you truly are. This is how I am, and I know I could never be anything else». Giorgio Armani is sitting in his office, and right next to him is his General Manager Livio Proli, the man in charge of the executive team he helped bring together in the last few years. It is going to be a long interview, but Giorgio Armani is ready and willing to embark on a frank discussion. For reasons of space, only the major points are outlined here. Let’s talk about your Foundation, which has received 0,1% of Giorgio Armani Ltd, the holding company. What will be the role of the Foundation and who will be leading it? «The Foundation has two aims. On the one hand, to reinvest capitals for nonprofit initiatives, and on the other to ensure a proper balance within the holding company. What we’ve put together is a mechanism which will motivate my successors to live in harmony and prevent the group from being bought out by third parties or broken up. I will be in charge of the Foundation for as long as I live, and after me my place will be taken by three people I will nominate». Will some of your heirs be involved in the Foundation? «My heirs will continue to sit on the Board of Trustees of the Giorgio Armani Ltd, as they do today, and they will own shares of the holding, as specified in my will. The Board will also include a representative of the executive team, same as now, plus two outside members. The whole project has been disclosed to my family (his sister and his three nephews, as well as Leo Dell’Orco, who is in charge of the men’s fashion line and has been on the Board since the very start, Editor’s note) during a Board meeting last year, when I decided to set up my Foundation». What strategy have you put in place to prevent disagreements from arising within the family? «I do not foresee any disagreements, at least I hope there won’t be any, but I have made a point to establish an even number of members sitting on the Board. In case of a tie, the Foundation will hold the balance of power. It will make decisions as I would, on the basis of guidelines I have already established and following precise criteria in order to break a deadlock. These criteria are based on three words: consistency, loyalty and commitment to the company». From Warren Buffett to Bill Gates, in the States, there is an increasing trend to pass on family fortunes not to family, but to charities. Have you tried to follow this path insofar as our laws – which are different to American laws – will allow it? «My heirs will be more than satisfied with their personal inheritance. But apart from that, they will have the Foundation at their side, a strong financial player which will enable them to make the most of what the Giorgio Armani brand has achieved so far, and to help the holding expand even more». A sale is just not on the cards, is it? «Part of the Giorgio Armani Holding will be transferred directly to the Foundation. There will be mechanisms put in place to allow my heirs to sell their share directly to the Foundation, should they wish to do so». Will you allow your management team to become shareholders? «They will have positions, but no shares».What are your plans for your properties? «The properties belonging to Giorgio Armani Ltd will remain with the company. As for the other buildings and estates, I’m trying to decide which ones to pass on. Believe me, thinking about all this keeps me awake at night! It’s horrible having to decide, I’ll bequeath this or that, am I doing the right thing, every five minutes you are aware that something unexpected could happen to you at any moment. It’s the same for everybody, I know, but it’s much more likely when you’re 83». Which charitable projects are you envisaging for the Foundation? «We don’t have a specific project at the moment, but we do get dozens of requests every single day… As we have done in the past, we intend to keep taking care of the needs of disadvantaged children and to look after the elderly; we are interested in urban planning and in sporting activities as an educational tool to improve young people’s lives. We are interested in anything that can accrue the value of human beings». Loyalty, consistency, commitment… you don’t hear these words very often in this day and age. «I have been very lucky to believe in these values, which have always been my guiding light in both my personal and professional life». Let’s go back to your company, the Giorgio Armani Ltd of today. In 2016 you declared a 5% decline in profits. Do you see there the beginning of a crisis? «Do you really think that a company with 880mn in hand – due to rise to 1bn by the end of this year – is facing a crisis? We foresee the same decline in profits in the current year as well, and in 2018. It’s part of a controlled strategy in view of an upswing in 2019». What do you mean by controlled? «When we bought back A/X Armani Exchange in 2014, we gained 14% simply by incorporating its 300mn turnover. The acquisition was necessary to deal with an unsatisfactory situation but, as of 2016, we repositioned our brand and reduced distribution in order to create the best conditions for further growth. However, if we care to keep our good relations with our old partners, we need to invest as long as it takes, time-wise, to achieve this, and time comes at a price».You brought two lines, Armani Collezioni and Armani Jeans, into Emporio. Why? «This is a period of utter confusion in our market, in fashion you see all sorts of ideas coming up all the time, some very fanciful indeed, but then they prove hard to sell in the shops. As far as we are concerned, we intended to streamline our offer in order to give our customers a clearer vision, so we incorporated those fashion lines that embodied a particular moment in time. In some way, it was a form of self-criticism. Our brands today are Giorgio Armani, Emporio Armani and Armani Exchange, side by side with the high fashion Privé line and Armani Casa». Up to now, you haven’t made much of an impact in the digital world. It is rumored however that a new manager is on his way. «Yes, a new manager will be joining us soon (replacing Barbieri, Editor’s note), but we can’t reveal his name just yet. On the digital scene we have been very busy indeed, but maybe we haven’t been very good at communicating our initiatives. This week we’ll be launching our new site where just the Giorgio Armani and Emporio brands will be visible for the time being. We haven’t decided yet if we want to pool all the brands in one “container” or to set up an individual space for each of them. We have just renewed our contract with Ynap for the next 10 years. In the past few days they have provided our new platform and we have just finished setting up our production centre for digital content at the headquarters in Via Bergognone, an investment which has cost us several million euros and which will allow us, in a very short time, to create photo and video contents to be issued in real time. By next March, we reckon everything will be operational, thanks to our new manager who will bring in his excellent e-commerce skills».You are a fashion specialist, but do you want to keep making just clothes? «I’d like to get into quality accessories and we are working on it». You tried it in the past, are you thinking of buying another brand now? «We thought about an acquisition but I’m not entirely convinced. I know from experience that acquisitions can bring along a lot of complications as well. In 2009 we bought Guardi shoes and De Mutti handbags, and they just didn’t live up to our expectations. And then I thought, if I have to tell someone else what to do, wouldn’t it be better if I did it myself? Now we are busy setting up the whole production chain: we have hired skilled staff with experience in accessories and we are planning to launch our first collection in the Spring, aimed at Autumn/Winter 2018. The sale of these products will be restricted to our shops and to some of our special clients , who are also opinion leaders and will be able to tell us if we’re heading in the right direction. If all goes according to plan, the real launch will be for the Spring/Summer collection». What are your targets? «Today 85% of our turnover is based on clothing and 15% on accessories. In the next three years, we’d like to reach a 70/30 ratio». During the last Milano XL event, I saw you at the Scala Theatre in Milan. You were with Miuccia Prada, Pierpaolo Piccioli from Valentino and Alessandro Michele from Gucci. Valentino and Gucci are in foreign hands now, unlike you and Prada. Do you agree with Francesco Trapani, ex CEO at Bulgari’s and now shareholder at Tiffany’s, who claims it’s impossibile to have an Italian group as big as Lvmh or Kering? «There is really no need to, in my opinion. But then again, when you think of Vuitton’s influence in the media and in investment strategies, obviously you start wondering. However, I intend to be the lord in my castle, in a positive sense, of course, meaning I want to retain the ability to choose. Here we are, the Armani group, we have our identity, our creed. I’d like to keep things this way for as long as I’m around». You were never tempted to sell in the past? «I could have done it a million times and in some instances it’s been very hard to say no – especially to private equity funds – because that means money, lots of it, and on the nail… but I guess it just wouldn’t be me, the way I am. And I’m fortunate to be kept so busy, day in, day out, that I really can’t find the time to give much thought to these matters». At one point, it was reported there was a joint project with Luxottica, the company that produces your glasses. And you own 5% of Luxottica. «There was indeed a time when we thought we could do something together, but in Luxottica I found a management style I could never get on with. However I remain a strong admirer of Del Vecchio, he’s done remarkable things». But you’re determined to hang on to that 5% in Luxottica. «You bet I am! After the merger with Essilor it will become 2,5% of a very powerful integrated group». In the meantime, here you are, at your desk. «Sure, same as always. I’d like to reassure all the people who encourage me daily to keep going, to have faith in my choices and priorities, in the same values that have inspired me so far and will guide the company in the future. To all those people I’d like to say that I am still here and will always be here». (Traduzione di Rita Baldassarre) 23 ottobre 2017 (modifica il 23 ottobre 2017 | 07:52) © RIPRODUZIONE RISERVATA

thread.title: Pre-match readings from Anne Frank’s diary at stadiums
thread.title_full: Pre-match readings from Anne Frank’s diary at stadiums

posts.author: Andrea Arzilli and Rinaldo Frignani
posts.title: Pre-match readings from Anne Frank’s diary at stadiums
posts.text:
Twenty fans, including some already known for hooliganism , have already been called in for questioning, including a 17-year-old and a 13-year-old. They are all Lazio fans – identified by the DIGOS using video surveillance footage of the terraces in the south sector of Rome’s Olympic Stadium –, who on Sunday evening filled the sector reserved for Roma fans with dozens of anti-Semitic stickers depicting Anne Frank wearing Roma’s red and yellow jersey. Italy’s president, Sergio Mattarella, called it “an alarming, inhuman act,” while interior minister Marco Minniti assured that those responsible for “such base conduct” would be persecuted and “banned from stadiums for life”.
Italy’s football association, Federcalcio, in agreement with Italy’s Union of Jewish Communities and sports minister Luca Lotti , has decided that excerpts from Anne Frank’s diary will be read before kick-off at all of today’s Serie A, B and C matches, followed by a minute of silence. The children accompanying the players are to be given a copy of Primo Levi’s novel If this is a Man. Yesterday, Lotti also received a message from Israel’s sports minister, Miri Regev: “I hope Italy eradicates anti-Semitism”. Tonight in Bologna, Lazio will be warming up wearing a shirt bearing the face of the girl who has become a symbol of the Shoah. Their fans will sit in the visitors’ sector of the stadium dedicated to Arpad Weisz, a Hungarian football manager who was a victim of the Holocaust.
Yesterday, a visit to Rome’s synagogue by Lazio’s chairman Claudio Lotito to lay a wreath received an icy reception from the Jewish community, who did not send representatives to welcome the Lazio delegation. “The synagogue is not a washing machine, nor a place where you bring flowers to make everything right again,” said chief rabbi Riccardo Di Segni. “We are tired and dissatisfied with mere gestures that might seem to resolve the problem. What we need is concrete action, including repressive measures.”
News of the racist stickers has attracted criticism from around the world . According to Prime Minister Paolo Gentiloni, “something unbelievable and unacceptable has happened, and we should not play it down,” while Democratic Party secretary Matteo Renzi suggested that teams should go on the pitch “wearing the star of David on their shirts instead of their sponsors’ logos”. The curators of Anne Frank’s house in Amsterdam, said they were “shocked”. The president of footballers’ union Assocalciatori, Damiano Tommasi, accused Lotito of sidestepping the closing of the north (Lazio) sector of Rome’s stadium as a result of racist behaviour by allowing “offenders to use the south (Roma) sector”. In another development, the interior ministry may today propose exemplary punitive measures against Lazio and the club’s fans. Yesterday, Ascoli supporters announced that they would not observe the minute’s silence.
English translation by Simon Tanner www.simontanner.com
